content: Great question! Neumont College of Computer Science offers several Bachelor of Science degrees, including Computer Science (BSCS), Software & Game Development (BSGD), Applied AI & Data Engineering, Software Engineering (BSSE), and Artificial Intelligence Engineering (BSAIE). We also have a Master of Science in Applied Artificial Intelligence (MSAAI).
Tell me about your BSCS program.

Sure! Our Bachelor of Science in Computer Science (BSCS) is designed for students who want to explore modern languages and environments, design systems architecture, and integrate broad areas of technical knowledge. You can learn more about the BSCS degree on our website!
What can you tell me about your BSGD degree?

No problem! The Bachelor of Science in Software & Game Development (BSGD) is tailored for the gaming guru with impressive technical talent, an understanding of mathematics, and a willingness to learn. You will build a deployable game in a 10-week project course. Check our our website for more information
What is the BSAAI program about?

The Bachelor of Science in Applied AI & Data Engineering is designed for individuals who are passionate about cutting-edge technologies and eager to explore the latest advancements in AI and data engineering. More information can be found on our website.

This path is designed for students who are visionaries that will challenge their ingenuity to create innovative and effective improvements in large-scale distributed systems deployed in the cloud. View our website for more information.
Tell me about the BSAIE degree.
This program is ideal for the problem solver who is passionate about learning bleeding-edge AI technologies to help solve complex real-world problems. Our website has more information.
What are some of the benefits of attending Neumont?

Neumont College of Computer Science has several benefits, including real-world tech projects to gain experience, small personalized classes, and a community of like-minded students. Also, you can graduate in just 3 years and launch your career in a field with jobs growing at 3 times the rate of the national average for all occupations.
Yes, we do! Check our website to see more!
What kind of campus activities do you provide?
Everyone here is just like you. Scary, right? You won't find traditional college stereotypes at Neumont, but friends who love celebrating May the Fourth and Pi Day as much as you do.
